content.question: A <math alttext="10 volt" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">V</mi></math> battery, resistors with resistances of <math alttext="100 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>, <math alttext="200 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>200</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>, and <math alttext="400 ohms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>400</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">Ω</mi></math>, a <math alttext="12 microfarad" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>12</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>μF</mi></math> capacitor, and a switch are connected as shown. The capacitor is initially uncharged and the switch is initially open. What is the current in the battery immediately after the switch is closed?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
